definitions.definition: To prepare for something bad, such as an impact or blow.
To place in a position for resisting pressure; to hold firmly.
definitions.example: He braced himself against the crowd.

definitions.definition: To swing round the yards of a square rigged ship, using braces, to present a more efficient sail surface to the direction of the wind.
To stop someone for questioning, usually said of police.
To confront with questions, demands or requests.
To furnish with braces; to support; to prop.
definitions.example: to brace a beam in a building

definitions.definition: To draw tight; to tighten; to put in a state of tension; to strain; to strengthen.
To bind or tie closely; to fasten tightly.
(of multiple figures of the same form) Interlaced.
